author: Reuters Editorial
title: U.S., South Korea to pursue talks between Washington and Pyongyang
text:
SEOUL (Reuters) - The foreign ministers of the United States and South Korea agreed to continue working toward creating the right conditions for the United States and North Korea to talk, the Southâ€™s foreign ministry said in a statement on Friday.
U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo holds a joint press availability with South Korean Foreign Minister Kang Kyung-wha after their meeting at the State Department in Washington, U.S., May 11, 2018. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque South Korean Foreign Minister Kang Kyung-wha and U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo held a phone call and made the remarks after U.S. President Donald Trump called off a June summit with North Korea, the statement said.
Reporting by Christine Kim; Editing by Michael Perry
